document.docAuthor: Slimani, Noura, Moulet, Pierre, Chen, Ping-Ping, Nieser, Nico, Pluot-Sigwalt, Dominique, Boumaïza, Moncef & Guilbert, Eric
document.masterDocTitle: Checklist, distribution, and a new record of Nepomorphan water bugs (Hemiptera: Heteroptera) in northern Tunisia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Checklist, distribution, and a new record of Nepomorphan water bugs (Hemiptera: Heteroptera) in northern Tunisia

subSubSection.paragraph:
Comments. This species is abundant and widespread in Tunisia . Specimens were collected in springtime, in temporal or permanent streams, with abundant riparian vegetation. It was first recorded from Tunisia by
Horváth ( 1906 )
under the name of
Notonecta glauca
L. var. maculate Fabricius
in Oued Melina.
